title: Add predefined item list with fixed prices for quick add to cart

requirements.text: Add a predefined item catalog (a list of items with fixed unit prices) to the calculator UI so a user can quickly add an item into the current line items/cart without manually typing the name and unit price.

quotes: i want to add a list of items with a set amount for each item so that it is easy to add in to the cart

acceptanceCriteria: A new UI section is visible on the main calculator page that displays a list of predefined items with their names and fixed unit prices.
Each catalog entry includes an explicit action (e.g., “Add”) that adds the item to the line items table.

When a catalog item is added, a new line item row is created with: label prefilled to the catalog item name, unitPrice prefilled to the catalog item price, and quantity set to a sensible default (e.g., 1).
Adding catalog items updates the subtotal and final total immediately using the existing calculation logic.
User-facing text for the new UI is in English.

requirements.text: Provide basic catalog usability so the predefined list is practical to use when it grows beyond a few items.

quotes: add a list of items with a set amount for each item

acceptanceCriteria: The catalog UI supports quickly finding items (e.g., a search/filter input that filters by item name).
Catalog prices are displayed using the existing currency formatting (consistent with the rest of the app).
The catalog UI is responsive and does not break the existing layout on mobile and desktop (e.g., stacks appropriately in the current grid).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything in frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Keep all logic client-side unless persistence is explicitly requested; backend/main.mo currently has no methods and should not be changed for this request.
nonGoals: Persisting the predefined item list or cart contents across sessions/devices.
Implementing checkout, payments, inventory management, or multi-user carts.
Adding third-party integrations or external databases.
